extractions: {"position": null, "sentence": "A Mann-Whitney U test indicates that there is no significant difference between PB and PLA in terms of occupancy level, U = 239030.5, p = 0.92 ", "statisticType": "mwutest", "record": {"pval": "0.92 ", "U": "239030.5", "r": null, "z": null}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "A t-test finds a significant difference in the mean Likeability score between PB (M=4.09, SD=0.56) and PLA (M=4.48, SD=0.64; t(25)=-1.69, p=0.05", "statisticType": "ttest_apa", "record": {"doF": "25", "pval": "0.05", "tstat": "-1.69"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "Shapiro-Wilk Test [64] indicates PB (p = 0.12)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "0.12"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Shapiro-Wilk Test [64] indicates PB  RPLUS MATCH  is normally distributed, while PLA (p = 0.0008)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "0.0008"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "An one-way ANOVA showed that there was a significant effect of device used on RMS ay : F(2,58723)=78.9, p<.001", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "78.9", "pval": ".001", "doF": "58723"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "First, our Cicero compiler detects associated elements depending on how a user has defined the original design (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Second, a transformation affecting the layout of a series of elements, such as adding, removing, or repositioning, has a downstream effect on the layout of their associated elements (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "First, when adding a new element to a series of elements, its appearance should mimic the existing elements in the series (P3)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "3"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Second, our Cicero compiler considers the appearance of elements in a similar role for new elements that are not part of an existing series of elements (P4)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "4"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Third, when there are multiple series of existing elements, our Cicero compiler selects the one with the most similar structure (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "In this case, the compiler should leverage the following default behavior if not specified otherwise: as an overarching principle, use the default options of the rendering grammar\u2019s compiler (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As an overarching principle, our compiler applies the current rule to a view that has been transformed by the previous rules (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "This approach also implies that the compiler applies the last declared rule (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Next, our compiler assigns higher priority to a more specific rule than a more generic rule for the same element (P9)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "9"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Filtering out the data points removes (1) the two simple line marks for the forecast year of 2010 and 2011, (2) the data annotation for forecast year 2010, and (3) the corresponding parts of the area and black line mark for the actual GDP growth rates because each of these elements is associated with the filtered data (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "This association is determined by the original visualization structure; if the annotations were declared as non-data elements, then the annotation for the 2010 forecast would remain (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "To address this issue, the rule in line 15\u201321 changes the scale domain of the row field (growth) to [3,5], resulting in the removal of the axis label and grid line for 5.5; the remaining elements automatically adjust to fill the newly vacated space (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Currently, one potential pitfall is attempting to explain too much, or too deep into the technical stack, which might actually constrain a physician\u2019s ability to see and understand the more clinically relevant aspects of AI. {"position": null, "sentence": "Physicians mentioned that Augmenting CXR images with specific inquiries and Mediating system complexity by urgency level helped narrowing down the information when understanding AI and sorting significant observations fast\u2014\u201dthey help me to focus on observations that AI thinks are more likely to be related to my input questions\u201d (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "We recommend that, instead of adjusting time, the system should let a physician freely control the amount of information they would like to process, from trying to make sense of only the critical results, to revealing more explanation hierarchically, and to referencing other regional, previous or cross-patient examples. {"position": null, "sentence": "Passive drift indicates when the participant has nothing to do, such as boredom, e.g., \u201c[sitting on an empty bus,] I am doing nothing now [observed drift], so I think it\u2019s good to learn words (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "I don\u2019t think it\u2019s a good time [for microlearning]. (P4)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "4"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Participants shared in their interview that microlearning was better supported by drifts that are longer than 3 minutes (\ud835\udc40\ud835\udc3c \ud835\udc41 = 3, \ud835\udc40\ud835\udc34\ud835\udc4b = 6, \ud835\udc40 = 4.3, \ud835\udc46\ud835\udc37 = 1.18): \u201cI think I want to learn [3-6 words] when the duration is about 5 minutes [on the metro] (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As described by some participants, \u201c[standing on the metro] I will get down in 2 minutes, it\u2019s not worthy to open the app (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "So why not start learning after sitting down on the bus? (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "I prefer doing more valuable things like vocabulary learning to refresh my mind. (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "I need to relax, I don\u2019t want to learn now. (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "I need to nod down to look at the screen, and it hurts my neck. (P4)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "4"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "I need to nod down to look at the screen, and it hurts my neck.  RPLUS MATCH \u201d Additionally, three participants did not prefer using mobile phones for learning vocabulary while commuting due to their propensity to motion sickness, \u201cI can not focus [a] long time on [the] phone especially on [the] bus as I feel carsick. (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "Video coding for a participant (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The participants that sit in the back have significantly longer mean fixation durations (M = 222.6ms, SD = 14.57ms) than the participants that sit in the front (M = 218.75ms, SD = 13.11ms), with F (1, 272) = 6.7, p = .01", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "6.7", "pval": ".01", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The results reveal significantly longer saccade durations in the front condition (M = 50.23ms, SD = 1.7ms) than in the back condition (M = 47.9ms, SD = 2.62ms), with F (1, 272) = 73.76, p < .001", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "73.76", "pval": ".001", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Visual Attention and Cognition in VR through Eye Tracking is significantly larger in the front condition (M = 10.93\u25e6 , SD = 1.54\u25e6 ) than in the back condition (M = 10.05\u25e6 , SD = 1.38\u25e6 ), with F (1, 272) = 22.6, p < .001", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "22.6", "pval": ".001", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The mean fixation durations are significantly longer in the cartoon-styled avatar condition (M = 222.88ms, SD = 14.06ms) than in the realistic-styled avatar condition (M = 218.6ms, SD = 13.76ms), with F (1, 272) = 5.27, p = .022", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "5.27", "pval": ".022", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "By contrast, the mean saccade durations are significantly shorter in the cartoon-styled avatar condition (M = 48.58ms, SD = 2.66ms) than in the realistic-styled condition (M = 49.3ms, SD = 2.35ms), with F (1, 272) = 6.22, p = .013", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "6.22", "pval": ".013", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Significant differences are highlighted with * for p < .05.  The normalized mean pupil diameter, which reflects the cognitive load, is significantly larger in the realistic-styled avatar condition (M = 0.94, SD = 0.16) than in the cartoon-styled avatar condition (M = 0.91, SD = 0.13), with F (1, 272) = 3.94, p = .048", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "3.94", "pval": ".048", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "We found significant effects on normalized mean pupil diameter values with F (3, 272) = 4.78, p = .003", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "4.78", "pval": ".003", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Particularly, mean pupil diameter in the 80% hand-raising condition (M = 0.96, SD = 0.16) is significantly larger than in the 35% hand-raising condition (M = 0.9, SD = 0.12), with F (3, 272) = 4.78, p < .001", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "4.78", "pval": ".001", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "In addition, we found significant effects on number of fixations with F (3, 272) = 3.01, p = .03", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "3.01", "pval": ".03", "doF": "272"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Summary of roles and application domains of interview participants.  3.1  Overall perspectives on embedding analysis  Most of the embedding experts we interviewed expressed a largely unmet need for tools to help them understand their models: \u201cthe tools are very crude, and you\u2019re kind of just getting small clues from those little [ad hoc] techniques\u201d (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "In some cases, embedding analysis plays a distant secondary role to task-specific performance metrics; understanding the embedding space is often only useful to debug an underperforming model (P4)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "4"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "However, these participants are also concerned that the methods they are currently using are too \u201chand-wavy\u201d (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Furthermore, their analytical techniques depend on the presence of previously-known points of interest, which they may not have when exploring new datasets (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Experts in computational biology in particular use DR extensively, not only to validate that their embedding models place similar cells close together but also to \u201ccreate the figures that biologists can appreciate\u201d (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "And it doesn\u2019t really give you those answers.\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "So we were looking at clusters as a way to understand what notion of similarity the feature representation is capturing, and whether that\u2019s the notion of similarity that we actually want to capture.\u201d (P9)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "9"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "For simplicity and to adopt well-established techniques, we focus on the three main techniques described above as our design focus. 3.3  Needs and makeshift strategies for embedding comparison  Unlike the techniques that participants use to understand individual embedding spaces, approaches for comparing more than one embedding space at a time were \u201cvery rudimentary\u201d (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "When asked about the types of comparative analyses they would like to conduct, one participant answered that they would simply like to \u201cidentify the points that move the most\u201d (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Some participants described validating embedding spaces by comparing examples to their prior knowledge about the specific data (P6, P7), while others develop a more long-term \u201cintuition around what\u2019s going on across different models and across different approaches\u201d (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Exploration: At this stage, the experts aim to determine when and where to deploy what policies (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Simulation: At this stage, with the model parameters and policy, the simulation mechanism shall be well suited to accept and execute complicated policies (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The information content of sonified network packets, compared with auditory alerts, was highlighted as advantageous by one participant: \u201cthe music can tell me, something else has happened [...] and not just as an \u2013 alert, alert, alert\u201d (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Missed information on monitors at the front of the SOC was reported, if practitioners were engaged by other screens: \u201csomething on this [front] screen could be red, but if they\u2019re already doing a priority 1, they\u2019re not going to look over there seeing the other priority 1\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Smaller SOCs, in which one-man shifts occurred, as well as companies running their own SOCs, were mentioned as situations in which this capability might be especially helpful: \u201cthe guy running his own SOC, the SOC won\u2019t be his only task, he might be plumbing computers in the main office, and want to come back in if something big happens\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Participants felt that sonification could be useful as an approach to informing practitioners on break that they are required in the SOC, played through speakers in break areas (e.g., the kitchen), or through an earphone worn while on break: \u201cthey wouldn\u2019t need to rush back, keep checking, they could just go about their business and know \u2018right, when I hear that sound, I need to take whatever action\u2019\u201d (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Other Use-Cases Suggested by Participants Aside from the use-cases we presented, other uses were suggested by participants, falling under the following themes. 1) Occasional use: It was suggested that the sonification could be used to occasionally check the sound of the network: \u201cI might listen to it once an hour, and go \u2018[...]it doesn\u2019t sound the same at 1 o\u2019clock today as it did at 1 o\u2019clock the last three days\u2019\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Similarly, sonification could be played in the background particularly at times when high-severity incidents were being dealt with, to act as an indicator for SOC workers when a new incident may require their attention (P8)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "8"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Otherwise I might spend an hour just looking at some packets with nothing particularly interesting in\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The potential to listen to the sonification at increased speed (fast-forwarding), both for conducting audio reviews of data retrospectively (\u201cif you\u2019ve got an alarm or a period that you\u2019re interested in\u201d), and for real-time monitoring was discussed: If you had a baseline amount of traffic, you could go \u201cI\u2019ll listen to a minute of that, now I\u2019m going to listen to a minute of what has just gone through the sensors\u201d, maybe accelerated, you will then start straight away going \u201cthat doesn\u2019t sound right\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Complexity of Networks Participants discussed the difficulty of finding unusual behaviour in networks: \u201cthe more complex your network is, the more difficulty you have working out what is unusual\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "However, the duration needed to take photos of both left and right eyes was significantly lower, t(26) = -2.17, p < .05", "statisticType": "ttest_apa", "record": {"doF": "26", "pval": ".05", "tstat": "-2.17"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "As expected, we observed differences in trustworthiness between the design alternatives (Figure 8), F(3,36) = 3.84, p < .05", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "3.84", "pval": ".05", "doF": "36"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "When provided with disease information (M = 5.33, SD = 1.26), participants reported higher trustworthiness compared to the other design alternatives, t(36) = 2.68, p < .05", "statisticType": "ttest_apa", "record": {"doF": "36", "pval": ".05", "tstat": "2.68"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Also, a mismatch between assessment and diagnosis led to the lowest trustworthiness, t(36) = -2.86, p < .05", "statisticType": "ttest_apa", "record": {"doF": "36", "pval": ".05", "tstat": "-2.86"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "While the integrity dimension score was affected by the design alternative, F(3,36) = 5.23, p < .05", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "5.23", "pval": ".05", "doF": "36"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Similarly, the design alternative had an effect on the benevolence score, F(3,36) = 3.08, p < .05", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "3.08", "pval": ".05", "doF": "36"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Lastly, there was a difference in ability, targeted through disease information, between the design alternatives F(3,36) = 6.42, p < .001", "statisticType": "anova_apa_no_r", "record": {"Fval": "6.42", "pval": ".001", "doF": "36"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Consistent with our hypothesis, information about color-blindness led to higher ability, t(36) = 3.18, p < .05", "statisticType": "ttest_apa", "record": {"doF": "36", "pval": ".05", "tstat": "3.18"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Interrelationship among social characteristics  According to the surveyed literature, proactivity influences perceived personality (P1)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "1"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "When the proactive messages are based on the context, proactivity increases perceived conscientiousness (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "Proactivity supports communicability (P3)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "3"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Proactivity supports communicability  RPLUS MATCH  (Chaves & Gerosa, 2018; Silvervarg & Jo\u0308nsson, 2013; Vale\u0301rio et al., 2017), since a chatbot can proactively communicate its knowledge and provide guidance; in addition, proactivity supports damage control (P4)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "4"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Conscientiousness is itself a dimension of the Big Five model; hence, conscientiousness influences the perceived personality (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "Conscientiousness manifests emotional intelligence (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "In addition, conscientiousness manifests personalization (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Differences in the underlying data caused rankings to vary between trials for the same participant, with only two participants assigning the same ranks to DP and DS for all four maps, and only one participant assigning completely consistent ranks in the Gapminder condition. 7.4.2 Dynamic Behavior Participants used both the dynamic behavior of the points and their initial and final states when identifying trends; e.g., P7 felt two countries were close in behavior \u201cbecause position-wise they\u2019re converging to the same place and [...] color-wise they\u2019re also doing [the] same.\u201d P9 focused on dynamic behavior; i.e., \u201cthey didn\u2019t start [...] similar to each other, but their rapid growth was similar.\u201d When describing similarities in dynamic behavior, participants commented mostly on direction and magnitude of the change: \u201cIt\u2019s moving the same way, moving in the same direction at nearly the same speed\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "The perceived synchrony of change also seemed important for dynamic behavior: \u201cthey changed almost at the same time [...] the brightnesses are getting darker [in the] same direction at the same time\u201d (P5)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "5"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "Though our definition of common fate similarity in \u00a7 4.3.2 is independent of proximity (SP-similarity), participants reported that it was easier to group data points together using one of the dynamic variables if they were close together; e.g., \u201cThey are also close to each other, so it was easy to detect them\u201d (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "While close distances seemed to facilitate comparison and group identification for some participants, sparsity also played an important role in detecting dynamic behaviors: \u201cThis one is more noticeable than other circles because it\u2019s isolated\u201d (P2)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "2"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
{"position": null, "sentence": "The circles are becoming extremely sparse!\u201d (P7)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "7"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "A common motivation scenario is that \u201cautomated methods do not solve the problem\u201d (P10), bringing the need to \u201cintegrate computational methods with humans through interactive visualizations\u201d (P6)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "6"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}

{"position": null, "sentence": "On the one hand, newcomers not having prior knowledge could rely more on generic listenable features while interacting with unknown music (e.g. tempo): \u201cPeople who don\u2019t know much about a particular genre, probably would agree on some things that are a bit more generic\u201d (P3)", "statisticType": "other", "record": {"pval": "3"}, "aspect": null, "condition": null}
